H0.text: Four haploid cells are produced by the end of meiosis.

H1.text: Sixteen haploid cells are produced by the end of meiosis.

H2.text: Eight haploid cells are produced by the end of meiosis.

H3.text: Three haploid cells are produced by the end of meiosis.

A4.text: Meiosis ( ) is a special type of cell division ... ultimately result in four cells, each with only one copy of each chromosome (haploid).

A5.text: The result is the production of four haploid cells (n chromosomes; 23 in humans) from the two haploid cells ... produced in meiosis I.
